Summary: Dr. Sophia Nnenna Ononye-Onyia is a Nigerian-American entrepreneur, former Pfizer scientist and Yale-trained molecular oncologist who utilizes her multidisciplinary background (PhD, MPH, MBA) and diverse therapeutic area experience to advise clients in the life science industry. She is the Founder and CEO of The Sophia Consulting Firm where she leads client counsel in the biotech and health tech space on strategic marketing, social media and corporate communications with the goal of amplifying scientific innovation. Most recently, Dr. Ononye-Onyia was selected to join the inaugural class of the EY Entrepreneurs Access Network (EAN). She is on the Advisory Council of the Dell Women's Entrepreneur Network (DWEN) and is the President of the New York Chapter Board of Directors for the Healthcare Businesswomen’s Association (HBA). Dr. Ononye-Onyia is also the Host and Producer of her firm’s Amplifying Scientific Innovation Podcast, which has received over 400,000 views on YouTube and featured over 40 CEOs and senior executives in biotech and Big Pharma companies who share perspectives on their unique leadership journey, corporate vision and industry outlook. Under her firm's 'Amplifying Scientific Innovation' platform, she recently launched her Virtual College Seminars and Virtual Professional Conferences to bolster science education. She serves as a Key Advisor and Board Member for Biotech and HealthTech companies in addition to universities and professional societies. She’s an Editorial Advisory Board Member for Cell & Gene, member of the Entrepreneur Leadership Network and contributor for several leading outlets inclusive of Inc. and MIT Technology Review. Dr. Ononye-Onyia is the recipient of numerous honors and awards, including the Tradition of Excellence Award from the UConn School of Pharmacy (2021), two consecutive HBA Spark Awards (2019, 2020); a 2020 Dell Women's Entrepreneurial Network (DWEN) Woman of the Week recognition; and a 2019 Congressional Letter of Recognition for the Face2Face Africa 30 Black Stars Transformational Business Leader award. Most recently, Commetric recognized her as the Top Digital Health Influencer on Twitter in the FemTech/Women's Health space. To learn more, please visit sophiaconsultingfirm.com, connect on Twitter (twitter.com/drsophiao) and subscribe to The Sophia Consulting Firm's YouTube Channel: https://tinyurl.com/SCFPodcast.

Summary: Sanjeev Thohan is a highly motivated research scientist who with every move has sought new challenges to overcome. He holds MS and PhD degrees in Pharmacology and Toxicology with concentrations in drug metabolism mechanisms, bioactivation pathways, and systems toxicology. He has actively contributed to: preparation of Pre-IND/IND, NDA and proof of concept documentation to support regulatory filings as preclinical development continues; inter-species scaling and projection of FIM dosage algorithm development; metabolic pathway elucidation and structural (SAR) feedback to medicinal chemistry for additional iterations based on biological data streams; high throughput bioanalytical method development/transfer, as well as troubleshooting for rapid method development/implementation. He has also led teams for evaluation of strategic critical pathway development, implementation and execution to provide data front-loading and reduction in time to IND.  He is a highly motivated research scientist who has worked at Walter Reed Army Institute for Research, Covance Laboratories, AstraZeneca, Viropharma, Exelixis and as the founder of SARx Consulting it Novartis (NIBR), Xeris Pharmaceuticals and is currently at Kinnate Biopharma in San Diego. Sanjeev’s track record includes advancement of 36 small molecule compounds through discovery to IND and various stages of active clinical development since 1997 with four of these progressing to NDA thus far. Therapeutic areas in which he has been actively involved are oncology, cardiovascular, metabolic diseases and antimicrobial, as well as antiviral therapeutics. Sanjeev continues to be a contributing member of several national/international scientific societies. He is a very active speaker with local and national scientific groups regarding preclinical safety/Mechanistic Toxicology, ADME-PKPD relationships and translational sciences. He actively serves on the advisory boards for several startups.

Summary: I simply started my career as a woman in the workplace.   This led me to ultimately reaching the level of a global executive at two iconic companies, Johnson and Johnson and GE.  I truly learned how to develop and help individuals in achieving what they never thought was professionally possible, especially women and women of color.  I’ve been through the highs, lows and a crisis or two in Corporate America as a Black woman navigating to become a leader herself. I know what it really takes and it wasn't easy, but I was determined.    What these experiences also prepared and positioned me for was to become an expert in women’s leadership and the advancement of women and women of color into positions of leadership and authority in the workplace.  It prepared me to become the Founder and CEO of FrancineParham & Co., the holding company for the Sharpen Your Skills leadership and professional development programs and events. Also preparing me serve as a Senior Fellow at The Conference Board, a global think tank where my ideas and thoughts are important to move the agenda ahead for women and women of color in leadership. And most importantly to ensure that the right conversations and insights of other leaders and experts who are also committed to this work are heard on my channel, Advancing Women in the Workplace with FrancineParham and Co.   So, I hope that you can take away from all of my work and experiences of over two decades that I'm super focused on what women and women of color want and need to advance successfully in their careers. I’m continuing to share what I learned and know to help other women and women of color professionally advance as I did. I know that it takes more than just your technical skills and nothing is achieved alone. I’ve lived and practiced what I talk about and know to be the realities and the truths. I understand that it means being intentionally focused and most importantly learning and mastering the unwritten and unspoken skills needed for career advancement. Hence my work is designed and delivered to position women and women of color to be professionally successful by mastering those unwritten rules and unspoken skills.  And when I'm not helping with the advancement of women and women of color in the workplace, I'm spending time with my family, doing one of the things I love the most - writing and reading about so many interesting places l that I've learned about and hope to travel to one day, as well as engaging in meaningful conversations with longtime friends that I treasure and keep me grounded.

Summary: As an African-American Woman and member of the LGBTQ community, I am the 1st to own and lead a Biotechnology/Biopharmaceutical Manufacturing company - 65 years after Dr. Percy Lavon Julian and his company, Julian Laboratories, Inc. At LucasPye BIO our mission is to Lower the Costs for Biotherapeutic Drugs, Reduce Time to Market, and provide High-Quality / High-Pay Employment for Underserved Communities. Summary: 'Impossible is a word to be found only in the dictionary of fools.' Napoleon Bonaparte.    Post - Ph.D., I spent 8 years working for Sigma-Aldrich, Rhone-Poulenc Rorer (now Sanofi Aventis), and Applied Biosystems.  In 1996, I left Applied Biosystems to focus on my invention, the Ecological Funnel and I built a company around it, called #CPLabSafety. In December 2000, I founded NovaBay Pharmaceuticals.  In 2007, on the strength of our patented NVC-422 (Auriclosene) and NVC-101 (Avenova, NeutroPhase), and partnerships with Alcon-Novartis, KCI and later Galderma, my team and I, took the company public and along the way (2000-2015) we successfully raised ~$200 million from private, public and non-dilutive capital sources. In 2011, I formed Emery Pharma as a subsidiary of NovaBay. EMERY PHARMA In 2015, I took over Emery Pharma, and have since been expanding its capabilities, and moved the company from Emeryville to Alameda, CA (near San Francisco). My team and I built Emery Pharma as a company that can help early stage, 'seed funded' biopharma to Big Pharma, medical device, and cleantech companies with their R&D challenges.  Every day we face questions like: •	how do I quantitate XYZ compound in blood, urine...or does this compound have in-vitro / in-vivo activity? •	how do I know my compound is pure?  Or what is the impurity? •	How do I develop IP around my technology?  Emery Pharma can help! We have the instrumentation needed and more importantly the intellectual prowess that can figure out the toughest problems.   Over the last 20+ years our team has been exposed to multiple FDA clinical trials and have worked on medical devices from concept to FDA clearance.  We developed products such as: AVENOVA, NeutroPhase, CelleRx and built a 50 person commercial sales force in the USA to market AVENOVA. Those who know me well, understand my passion for innovation and my love for inventors who are aiming to save lives and save the environment. Summary: We live in a world where 95% of startup founders who set out to raise capital, fail for one reason or another.  I created Fulcrum Venture Accelerator to help fix this problem. After raising multiple rounds of financing at Kindara, I realized that instead of the disorganized approach that most founders take, I could take a systematic approach to raising capital.  I created a 5 step process for raising seed capital - Tilling, Planting, Watering, Harvesting, Closing. By defining the steps and following my own recipe, I not only knew exactly what to do at every step of my raise, I was also able to raise bigger and bigger rounds as Kindara grew.  After Prima-Temp acquired Kindara, I started helping friends raise seed rounds using the fundraising process I developed. I was excited to see that the process could be taught and applied successfully by entrepreneurs in different industries.  Running out of money is the #1 reason startups fail. I’ve seen many good companies fail because the founder wasn’t able to raise seed funding. Many founders go about the fundraising process in a disorganized and scattered way, or worse they don’t follow a process at all, and they end up wasting a huge amount of time and come up empty handed.  Of course this isn’t their fault, because nobody has been teaching founders a proven process to raise seed funding, and walking them through the steps until now.  In 2020 I founded Fulcrum, a fundraising accelerator for mission-driven entrepreneurs. Every quarter we look for the best companies with a positive social mission, and put them through a rigorous process of fundraising development to help them execute on their raise. We spend time making sure founders understand the process at a deep level, and execute a successful fundraise so they can close their round and get on with building their company.   I like to remind founders that they can delegate marketing, product, finance, customer support, operations, manufacturing, and design, but they can’t delegate fundraising. For this reason becoming excellent at fundraising can massively turbo-charge what a given founder is able to accomplish and the difference they are able to make.  We help our founders be among the top 1% of entrepreneurs when it comes to raising money. To date more than $20M in pre-seed and seed capital has been raised using our process. We look for high-caliber founders who are building something impactful and who are currently raising (or about to be raising) seed capital. Learn more and apply at www.fulcrumventureaccelerator.com

Summary: Isha has been pioneering the field of cellular agriculture for the past decade, since publishing the formative review 'Possibilities for an in-vitro meat production system' in the food science journal Innovative Food Science and Emerging Technologies in 2010. She quickly discovered that cellular agriculture research was not held back by a lack of interest or expertise, but instead by a lack of designated funding channels directed at this intersectional work. Thus began her quest to establish the field of animal products made without animals, one recognized by researchers, funding agencies, and investors. A stint in Policy and Public Affairs at GlaxoSmithKline illuminated the cooperative relationship between non-profits, academia, and companies in translating beneficial science out of the lab and into society. Isha has used a model established in the advancement of medical research to accelerate cellular agriculture, by funding early stage, foundational research in academia in order for ready-to-market technologies to be developed for commercial use. Isha became Executive Director of New Harvest in January 2013. She co-founded Perfect Day (fka Muufri), making milk without cows, in April 2014 and Clara Foods, making eggs without chickens, in November 2014. Isha has a BSc. in Cell and Molecular Biology from the University of Alberta and a Masters in Biotechnology from the University of Toronto.

Summary: I watched my close friend, Eric, be taken by cancer in six months' time.  My vibrant and energetic friend suffered from mouth sores that made eating painful, resulting in rapid weight loss and, ultimately, succumbing to his cancer.  His family and friends searched, but did not find, safe and clinically appropriate symptom management support.  I thought that if this could happen to Eric and his family, it must be happening to many people. I left my career on Wall Street and spent two years researching the scientific literature regarding the symptom and side effects experienced by cancer patients and interviewing cancer patients, caregivers, and the medical professionals who treat them so that I could create a solution to address these unmet needs in a scientific and clinically appropriate manner.  I found that nutritional strategies are effective in managing the symptoms of cancer and cancer treatment and represent an effective lever to improve outcomes and lower cost of care.  The result of this research is Ina ®, a virtual 'Intelligent Nutrition Assistant' chatbot who provides personalized nutritional strategies for symptom management 24/7 'on demand' via SMS text on a smartphone.  Licensed by healthcare enterprises and provided free of charge to cancer patients and caregivers, Ina ®, provides the support Eric and his family were searching for.

Summary: There’s so much you want to do, but time keeps slipping away.  You’re working in your day job, but find yourself constantly thinking about your passion. You want to make a change, and go all-in, but you can’t because you’re in need of a paycheck, or health insurance. DOES THIS STORY SOUND FAMILIAR? Don’t worry, because that was me, too — I was in your shoes. And lived it for MANY years. Then, in March 2020, just as the Coronavirus outbreak was occurring, my corporate job threw me a curveball, & vanished. It was an epiphany moment, & for the first time in 30 years, I was able to put all of my focus and attention into my business; helping my clients.  So how might this impact you?  You may be an expert in your industry, but nobody knows it… OR You may be a one-person show, & don’t have the capacity to produce content… OR Your company gets ignored because the competition outspends you. THIS USED TO BE THE CASE FOR MY CLIENTS WHO WERE: A.) People who don’t know how to find their voice or share their story effectively through writing and/ or video. B.) Summary: Kelly is a motivational Keynote Speaker and Media Dietitian. She has been seen on Good Morning America and is an expert in her field. Kelly graduated from West Virginia University in 2001 with a bachelor’s of Science in Nutrition and worked as a dietitian assistant in the hospital setting, until obtaining her Masters in Health Education from SUNY Cortland. After graduation, Kelly was asked to take on the role of Head Nutrition Educator for Cornell Cooperative Extension in Cayuga County.   Kelly then joined the team at Hillside Children’s Center. There she started a comprehensive wellness group that created guidelines to promote health and good nutrition. While working with Hillside, Auburn Memorial Hospital called and asked if Kelly could help with their Bariatric Center. She was a Bariatric Dieitian with Fingerlakes Bariatrics for the next three years. During her time there, she received her Registered Dietitian credentials via the Sodexo Distance Internship Program and a certificate in Adult Weight Management via The Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics.  Kelly started her private practice, collaborating with local physicians, in 2010. She counsels various nutrition related disease states. She still continues her private practice in Skaneateles, NY. Kelly’s Choice, LLC was created by Kelly in 2012. Her vision for the company is to educate others on her knowledge of nutrition through real people and real food. She has a wonderful group of contract employees that share her same goals and ideals. The company strives to spread their vision through work place wellness events, TV, publications and private practice.  Kelly's Choice partnered with Healthie, an online platform, that makes it easy for everyone to learn about nutriton. It is a multigenerational platform with webinar capabilities.

Summary: I am a partner at a litigation law firm in NYC and the Founder and CEO of Karta Legal LLC, a legal operations and technology management consulting firm. I am a graduate from the University of Pennsylvania Law School and a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt. Throughout my career, as a partner in private practice and in my current role, I have represented governmental and quasi-governmental agencies, as well as publicly-held Fortune 100 companies. I am honored to have been recognized as a Trailblazer by the New York Law Journal for being an 'agent of change, thought leader and innovator.'  For the past ten years, I have managed the Residential Mortgage Backed Securities (RMBS) litigation on behalf of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and various Federal Home Loan banks. Before that, I handled discovery management in the Bernie Madoff bankruptcy litigation. Outside the office, I sit on the Board of Birch Family Services, the Advisory Board of Higher Talent, and the Advisory Board of Merlin OpenSource Foundation. At Karta Legal, I have assembled an entire ecosystem to help organizations in their legal innovation journey. In my team, I have experts in change management, process improvement and mapping, technology, AI, cybersecurity, data science, e-discovery, project management, and litigation support. We know what works, what doesn't, and how much it should cost.  My goal is innovation and re-designing the delivery of legal services. The path to innovation is simple. First, focus on the people. Second, design or redesign the process. Third, pick the right technology for your specific needs and your budget. To achieve those goals, I use a variety of design thinking and business process improvement tools selected from Lean Six Sigma and Agile Project Management methodologies. Over the years, I have curated and tailored these tools to fit the needs of the legal industry and have applied them successfully. When asked to describe myself I say I am part: lawyer, process maven, technologist, educator, Lean Six Sigma facilitator, and innovation driver. Why should lawyers change the way we deliver legal services to our clients? The most fundamental reason is because we are duty bound to do so. We have professional, ethical, and fiduciary duties to continuously strive to eliminate the pervasive waste that exists in many of our legal processes, increasing the value of those services and ensuring data security in the process.

Summary: Having founded ramarketing from my spare room in 2009, I have grown the business beyond what I could have imagined. An international digital, design and content agency supporting clients in the life science space across the world. Today, I live in Boston - the epicentre of global drug development.  And I'm a proud keynote speaker, podcaster, blogger, guest lecturer and Forbes Agency Council Member. During my career, I’ve had the privilege of working with and advising over 60 brands in the life science supply chain globally on comms, digital marketing and creative strategy. Biotech, pharma, CMOs, CDMOs, CROs, CPOs, tech, equipment, testing firms - the lot.  As the team has expanded, my job has gone from doing the doing, to growing and leading the company, globally. This has been a tad stressful at times but a tremendously enjoyable ride. Our multi-award-winning company has offices in Newcastle and Manchester, UK and Cambridge/Boston, Mass, USA. So, what does ramarketing do? We’re in the business of helping fast-growing companies in the life science (pharmaceutical and biotech) sectors get noticed. We now work with some of the biggest names and fastest growing companies in the drug development supply chain. By helping clients unearth what makes them different, we enable them to raise profile, demonstrate expertise and secure inbound leads through a combination of tactics such as design, web, content, search and social. If our clients grow and succeed, then so do we. It’s pretty simple. One of the things I am most proud of is the team and the culture I have nurtured at ramarketing. I simply love my staff. They are awesome. We pay people well and give them a flexible work-life balance, which translates into a client-focused workforce and high staff retention. We're an agency driven by collective purpose and enjoyment, not money. We have as culture with genuine soul and personality. Today, I am as thirsty as ever for knowledge in a bid perfect my craft, grow the business and help more brands. I'm a keynote speaker at various business events and conferences. I guest lecture marketing and PR students and my insights have been covered by various publications. I also regularly appear on entrepreneurial podcasts across the UK and US to share my experience and knowledge.  So that's me. If you’re interested in me and what we do, get in touch. And enjoy my blogs and posts below.

Our commercial division has evolved into an exciting world of global investment opportunities providing fractional investment opportunities, golden visa citizenship opportunities, and global marketing services to international developers, all secured by our blockchain capabilities.  Our boutique residential brokerage excels due to extraordinary teamwork, providing a team of marketing, real estate, and technology professionals fully focused on our clients' needs. As an Industry Influencer and Blockchain Advisor, I consult to Consortia.realestate as a Board Member and SolidBlock.co as Advisory Board Member providing fractional ownership by tokenization and optimized referral relationships made possible via blockchain technology. In a nutshell. I live by the following mantra:  'If you don't think you're ever out of your depth, you aren't pushing yourself far enough.' Summary: I'm a co-founder of Kathera Bioscience and a pharma and biotech professional with more than 30 years of industry experience. KatheraBio’s mission is to treat serious, life threatening fungal infections.  Our company's name is derived from the Greek word 'kathairó' meaning to cleanse.   I was Director of Business Strategy & Development at Oncobiologics, Inc., and have held Business Development roles in Contract Research Organizations. My business development experience includes Sales, Licensing, Alliance Management and Contract Negotiation. As a consultant through SP Pharma Consulting LLC, I’ve provided strategic advice to biotech companies in new technology development and evaluation, technology due diligence and antifungal drug R&D.  At Merck & Co., I worked in drug discovery and preclinical development programs in therapeutic areas including infectious disease/antifungals, immunology and inflammation and sepsis. My group investigated the antifungal properties of the immunosuppressant FK-506, and played important roles identifying and characterizing FKS genes in budding yeast. Yeast Fks proteins are subunits of fungal beta-1,3-glucan synthase (GS), and targets of the first-in-class echinocandin drug CANCIDAS®. My lab also identified and characterized a murine gene encoding a C-type lectin expressed in subsets of immune sentinel dendritic cells. C-type lectins play important roles in pathogen pattern recognition, and regulation of host responses to bacteria, fungi and viruses.  I am also a Founder of the BioPharma Networking Group (BPNG) founded in 2012. BPNG has several active regional networking groups in North America including NJ, PA, NY, MA, NC, IN, St Louis MO, and Toronto.

Summary: CHIEF VISIONARY AND ENTREPRENEUR  Dr. Sarraf founded Amydis in 2013 to address the urgent medical and clinical need for an objective, non-invasive diagnostic to detect amyloid-associated diseases, the most well-known of which is Alzheimer’s Disease (AD). She brings a blend of large pharmaceutical operational expertise, venture investment background and entrepreneurship to Amydis. Dr. Sarraf is viewed as a visionary with a deep understanding of “cradle to grave” and the necessary components to achieve success from product concept through to commercialization. Previously, she spent 10 years in Venture Capital at Foresite Capital Management and Prospect Venture Partners, both growth capital healthcare funds with over $2B dollars in assets under management. There she led science, regulatory and commercial diligence on more than 700 investment opportunities from companies in therapeutic and diagnostic areas. Some successful investments and exits by Foresite with Stella’s leadership included Auspex Pharmaceuticals (sold to Teva for $3.5B in 2015) and Wavetec Vision (sold to Alcon in 2014).  Earlier in her career, Dr. Sarraf worked at Merck in Rahway, New Jersey as a senior research chemist responsible for creating the chemical synthesis of novel drug candidates for translation from the bench to clinical production. Most recently in 2016, Dr. Sarraf founded Spinogenix which is focused on developing novel neurorestorative therapeutics to combat neurological diseases with synaptic dysfunction, some of which include Alzheimer’s disease, Parkinson’s and Traumatic Brain Injury.  Dr. Sarraf holds a PhD in organic chemistry from Columbia University and earned a BA in biochemistry and molecular biology from the University of California, Berkeley.

Summary: Jean Paul Laurent is an award-winning social entrepreneur, published author, keynote speaker, devoted humanitarian, TEDx Lead Organizer, and one of the leading global oral health experts of his generation in consultative status with both the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) and the The United Nations Department of Global Communications (UN DGC) to help monitor and implement the international Agenda 2030 and the Sustainable Development Goals. Described as “a visionary leader and unshakable optimist,” Jean Paul has devoted his entire professional life leveraging capitalism and philanthropy — to direct attention to people who have been left behind. Since its inception in 2014, Jean Paul has grown Unspoken Smiles into a reputable and impactful nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting both long-term oral health and economic security in the world's most disadvantaged regions. By developing, supporting, and incubating those initiatives, Jean Paul has improved the oral health status of over 7000 children in 8 countries across 4 continents. Widely recognized for his bold vision, and innovative approaches, Jean Paul’s philanthropic achievements have garnered recognition from a variety of prestigious organizations including the Most Influential People of African Descent (MIPAD 100 Under 40 Lists), Lay’s, Thomson Reuters Foundation, Clinton Foundation, Ashoka, NYC Council, NYS Senate, U.S. State Department, and more. He has also received an Honorary Doctorate of Humane Letters for his extensive philanthropic contributions to his community and beyond from CICA. Currently, Jean Paul serves as a contributing writer for Forbes Nonprofit Councils, and his work has been featured on News12, Now This, ABC, Good Morning America, Huffpost, The Grio, and the New York Times, among other places. Jean Paul is currently enrolled in a Doctor of Education program at the University of Pennsylvania Graduate School of Education. He holds a Masters in Public Administration from Columbia SIPA, and has been a frequent speaker at global conferences, colleges and Fortune 500 companies. Summary: Tomi is currently Chief Drug Hunter and President, Maestro Therapeutics, a consulting/advisory enterprise that is engaging academia, biotech and pharma to support peptide drug discovery. He has recently retired from Merck Research Laboratories as Distinguished Scientist, Global Chemistry, where he provided leadership to the Peptide Drug Hunter Network and several peptide R&D programs as well as innovative core capabilities and knowledge engine. Tomi is an entrepreneurial drug hunter with four decades of industrial experience in both pharma and biotech. He is well known for his contributions to GPCR, kinase, protease and protein-protein interaction drug discovery. He has two marketed drugs, including Scenesse® (a peptide superagonist of MCR1 for the treatment of the orphan skin disease known as erythropoietic protophyria and related indications) and Iclusig® (a small-molecule inhibitor of Bcr-Abl kinase for the treatment of resistant forms of chronic myelogenous leukemia). Other examples of his drug development campaigns include the peptidomimetic renin inhibitor Ditekiren, a natural product macrocycle mTOR antagonist Ridaforolimus and the first stapled peptide dual MDM2–MDMX antagonist ALRN-6924. Tomi is credited with ~600 scientific publications, patents, and presentations and holds several Adjunct Professorships at the University of Massachusetts, the University of Massachusetts Medical School and Northeastern University Center for Drug Discovery. He is a Distinguished Alumni Scholar from his undergraduate alma mater, Minnesota State University at Moorhead, and served as a member of the MSUM Alumni Foundation Board of Directors. At his graduate alma mater, the University of Arizona, Tomi is a Distinguished Alumni Entrepreneur and has received a Professional Achievement Award from the Department of Chemistry & Biochemistry and the College of Science. Concurrently with Maestro Therapeutics, he is launching a Peptide Drug Hunter Consortium and the Saint Albert the Great Institute for Science, Faith & Wisdom.

As the current Lab Director at Trulieve, Mike built and manages the in-house analytical testing lab to measure cannabinoids as well as to detect contaminants such as pesticides, residual solvents, microbials, and mycotoxins. Summary: Since its establishment in 2009 , Sphinx has rapidly grown into a leading CRO and CMO that provides a broad spectrum of integrated chemistry services to the medicinal and pharmaceutical community worldwide.  　　Our US-based headquarters located in Sycamore, Illinois, is just minutes away from Northern Illinois University’s DeKalb main campus and within a hour’s drive to downtown Chicago and to one of the World’s main transportation hubs, the Chicago O’Hare International Airport. The company is equipped with the state-of-the-art facilities for modern chemical synthesis and analysis, and staffed with well-trained scientists and professionals. Two R&D centers, one located in Tianjin (North China) and the other in Nanjing (South China), occupy a total of 43,000 square feet of laboratory space, and both facilities possess their own advanced analysis labs. A 48,000 square feet cGMP plant in Qingdao, China is under construction and will be put into operation by April in 2014. Sphinx is committed to providing exceptional cost-effective and time-saving CRO and CMO services ranging from discovery chemistry to commercial production of pharmaceutical building blocks, intermediates and APIs for the pharmaceutical and bio-pharmaceutical industries. Sphinx has already accomplished over 2000 synthetic projects for the vast majority of leading pharmaceutical companies in the world. We have gained the reputation of being a most reliable partner in providing quality services to drug discovery and research in the pharmaceutical sectors as well as other life-science industries at large. Summary: Stephen A. Daire is a Master of Science in geographic information science and technology (GIST) – May 2019. He is from New Jersey and is a aerospace small business co-owner  Protean Solutions LLC, focusing on planetary sciences and spatial analysis via GIST and robotics in terms of cultural and natural resource survey, remote sensing, modeling, and spatial analysis.  His academic background includes a Bachelor of Science in evolutionary anthropology, a graduate certificate in evolutionary medicine, and a GIST graduate certificate. He is an Eagle Scout, Vigil Honor recipient, and a brother of Phi Kappa Tau. His work has focused on evolutionary biology, paleoepidemiology, paleoecology, paleontology, globalization, speleology, and digital cartography.  As a full cave-diver and American Academy of Underwater Sciences scientific diver, in completion, he has four years of imaging and optic calibration experiences of 130 hours submerged from 200 dives and experience from National Geographic Expeditions shipwreck and cave-diver mapping. His research aims to elucidate quantum physics, quantum biology, bioastronautics, and GIST topics within human evolutionary studies via planetary science analogs as a scientific-diver and scientist-astronaut applicant in underwater cave and high-altitude environments.  Stephen’s recent focus is on virtual reality and holographic geovisualization for use in research on spatial cognition in cave diving accidents, as well as autonomous robotics systems for mapping, particularly in planetary science analog submerged subterranean environments. Stephen will be conducting underwater laser scanning and astronautics field training for September and October of 2018.

Summary: Ashton Poole, Partner at NovaQuest Private Equity, has over 28 years of investment and transaction experience. He is responsible for transaction origination and execution, portfolio company value creation initiatives, investment policy, and investor relations. Mr. Poole is a member of the Private Equity investment committee and currently serves on the Board of Directors of Azurity Pharmaceuticals and CoreRx, two NovaQuest Private Equity portfolio companies. Prior to joining NovaQuest, Mr. Poole was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Triangle Capital Corporation, a publicly traded business development company making private debt and equity investments in lower middle market companies across a variety of industries, including healthcare. In that role, he was responsible for setting corporate strategy and managing key functional areas of the company, including investment origination, underwriting, portfolio monitoring, capital raising, and investor relations.  Mr. Poole served on the Management Committee, Investment Committee and Board of Directors of the company. Mr. Poole’s previous experience also includes 19 years of corporate finance and M&A advisory work for Morgan Stanley, where he was a Managing Director in the investment banking division and worked out of the New York office. Mr. Poole started his career in strategy consulting, where he worked for 3 years in San Francisco at The MAC Group, which was subsequently acquired by Gemini Consulting. Mr. Poole earned a BS in Business Administration from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a MBA from the J.L. Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University.
